## {.panelset}

<!--#region html items -->
### HTML

<div class='level1'>
- **Headings** \
There is up to 6 level headings, being `<h6> last heading level </h6>` the smallest one.
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Create lists** \
    + Ordered list \
    Example:
    ```html
    <ol>
        <li>First item</li>
        <li>Second list</li>
    </ol>
    ```
    `ol` = Ordered list \
    `li` = List item 

    + Unordered list \
    Example:
    ```html
    <ul>
        <li>One item</li>
        <li>Another item</li>
    </ul>
    ```
    `ul` = Unordered list
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Include an image** \
```html
<img src = "image.jpg" alt="name-for-image" width="number-of-pixels">
<!-- Example: -->
<img src = "pi.jpg" alt="sad_tree" width="1000">
<!-- Where the image pi.jpg is in the same folder as the HTML file. -->
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>
```

<div class='level1'>
- **Add links** \
```md
Example of link to website:
<a href="https://google.com">Click here</a> 
Where "a" stands for "anchor".

Example of link to html file in same folder as the one you'd be working with:
<a href="some-file.html">Click me</a>
```
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Create a table** \
Example:
```html
<body>
<table>
    <thead>
        <tr>
            <th>Ocean</th>
            <th>Average Depth</th>
            <th>Maximum depth</th>
        </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <td>Pacific Ocean</td>
            <td>4200 m</td>
            <td>10911 m</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>Atlantic Ocean</td>
            <td>3646 m</td>
            <td>8486 m</td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
</body>
```
Where the following stand for: \
`thead`: Table headings \
`tr`: Table row \
`th`: Table heading \
`tbody`: Body of the table \
`td`: Table data 
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Division of the page** \
It's not a division per se, but it works as a way to reference 
a certain section of the web page \
Example:
```html
<body>
<div>
    content
</div>
</body>
```
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Center a HTML table** \
```css
table {
    margin-left: auto;
    margin-right: auto;
}
```
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Define multiple classes for a HTML element** \
Inside the `< ... class="..."...>`, you can only use `class` once, but multiple
classes can assigned to some element via `< ... class="class-1 class-2" ...>`. \
Be careful with that option because a selection via `[class="some-class"]` will
only select the elements that have one class only, the *some-class* one. \
Better use something like `[class*="some-class"]` instead.
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Invalid characters inside a class name** \
Some special characters can not be inside a class name, or they can but require special 
rules to deal with it. \
More information: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/448981/which-characters-are-valid-in-css-class-names-selectors>
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Center HTML input tag** \
<https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9264835/how-to-align-an-input-tag-to-the-center-without-specifying-the-width>
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Display text in only one line** \
Add the CSS property `white-space: nowrap;` to what you wish
no line break. To control whatever text that may not be displayed in
the web page, use `overflow: ... ;`.\
For example, to hide the non shoen text, use
`overflow: hidden;` .
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Locate an element to top right corner of its parent container** 
Example:
```html
<div style='position: relative;'>
    <button style='position: absolute; right: 0;'>Click me</button>
</div> 
```
Setting `left 0` instead of `right: 0` makes the button be positioned on 
the top left corner of its parent `div`.

<div class='level2'>
- **Not inline styling** \
In the `head` section of a HTML document, you can include 
the style of HTML components via `<style>`. \
Example:
```html
<head>
<title> Hello! </title>
<style>
    h1 {
    color: blue;
    text-align: center;
    }
</style>
</head>
```
`Even better version:`
```html
<head>
    <title> Hello! </title>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css">
</head>
```
Where the arbitrary file `style.css` only contains the relevant CSS code.
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

Font types: <https://www.w3.org/Style/Examples/007/fonts.en.html> \
Example:
```css

font-size: 28px;
font-weight: bold;
}
```
That way, the font sans-serif will be applied in case that the browser
used does not recognize the other font, Arial in this case.

<div class='level1'>
- **Referencing HTML objects** \
You can use `class` to refer to a particular 
set of HTML objects; and, `id`, to refer to an unique HTML object. \
Example:
```html
<h1 id ="foo">Hello</h1>     Refer in CSS with #foo.
<h2 class="fue">Hola</h2>    Refer in CSS with .fue
```
The `specificity` CSS hierarchy  works as follows: \

1. inline 

2. id 

3. class

4. type

<div class='level2'>
- **Some selector examples** \
Useful explanation from <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/19931351/css-selectors-difference-between-body-h1-body-h1-and-body-h1>:
```md
* body.h1 will select the body element if it has a class of h1.
    (ex. <body class='h1'>this one</body>)
* body h1 will select all h1 elements in the body.
    (ex. <body><h1>this one</h1></body>)
    This is redundant in well-formed HTML, it will basically do the same thing as h1, 
    because the only place an h1 element can be (if your HTML is well-formed) is in the body)
* body .h1 will select all the elements that have the h1 class in the body.
    (ex. <body><div class='h1'>this one</div></body>)
```

<div class='level2'>
- **Hide scrollbar but retain functionality** \
In the following example, the class named `hidden-scroll` is the class of a tag which
can be scrolled, but its scroll bar is not shown. \
This option can be very useful for long math equations displayed on a HTML document, due
to the limitations of the MathJax library and how it displays LaTeX equations as images.
```css
/* Hide scrollbar for Chrome, Safari and Opera */
.hidden-scroll::-webkit-scrollbar {
    display: none;
}

/* Hide scrollbar for IE, Edge and Firefox */
.hidden-scroll {
    -ms-overflow-style: none;  /* IE and Edge */
    scrollbar-width: none;     /* Firefox */
}
```

The `&` symbol sets the creation of its CSS conversion (assuming $li-desdendants-height = 10) like so:
```css

    border-top: 1px solid black;

    line-height: 5.75vh;
}

ul.tocify-header.list-group:first-child { margin-top: 15px; }
```

<!--#region javascript items -->
### JavaScript

<div class='level2'>
- **Automatic scrolling** \
Example:
```js
// Choose some div (with overflow) to scroll
let scrollable = document.querySelector('div');
        
// Define the standard sleep() function
function sleep(miliseconds) {
return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, miliseconds));
}

let scrolling_time_in_miliseconds = 2000;
let scrolling_transition_animation_precision = 100;

async function initiateScrolling(){
// Incrementally scroll little by little many times in order to simulate a continuous transition
    for(var i=0; i<scrolling_transition_animation_precision; i++){
        await sleep(scrolling_time_in_miliseconds/scrolling_transition_animation_precision);
        scrollable.scrollBy(scrollable.scrollWidth/scrolling_transition_animation_precision,0);
    }
    
    // Wait one second and reset the scroll back (smoothly, continuously) to its starting position
    await sleep(1000);
    scrollable.scrollBy({
        left: -scrollable.scrollWidth,
        behavior: 'smooth' 
    });
}

// Perform the automatic scrolling
initiateScrolling();
```
For more information, visit <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/scrollBy> .
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level1'>
- **Remove characters from a string** \
This method involves turning a string into array of its characters,
removing some elements of such array and then join the characters left 
into a new string. \
Example:
```js
let t = document.querySelector('div');
// t is a div which contains some text

//  Convert string into array of characters
let texto = t["textContent"].split(''); 

// Remove the first two characters of the string
texto.splice(0,1); texto.splice(0,1);

// Remove the last two characters of the string
texto.splice(texto.length - 1 ,1); texto.splice(texto.length - 1,1);

// Set the initial text to its new value after joining the characters into a new string
t["textContent"] = texto.join('');
``` 
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>


<div class='level1'>
- **Play a sound multiple times** \
When you use a function like "click this and something will sound",
as it's common with virtual pianos, there may be a problem where, after 
click the _sound button_, you have to wait till the sound stops in order for the 
next button click to activate the same sound. \
The problem can be fixed using `currentTime = 0;` right before `play();`.
Example:
```html
<audio id="nota" preload="auto"><source src="musical_notes/C4.mp3"></source></audio>
<div id="sonido">
<p>Click me to play a sound</p>
</div>
<script>
    let audio;
document.getElementById(sonido).addEventListener('click',function() {
    audio = document.getElementById(nota);
    audio.currentTime = 0;
    audio.play();
}
</script>
```
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

        }

</body>

<div class='level2'>
- **Get IP of webpage visitor** \
Example using JQuery:
```js
// IPs of the visitors to this website for which
// we grant permission to see the content of the site.
const IP_exceptions = ['161.123.234.45','161.133.243.54']; 

let pagina = document.querySelector('html');

$.getJSON("https://jsonip.com/?callback=?", function (data) {
if( !( IP_exceptions.includes(data['ip']) )) { 
    // IP of user does not belong to someone granted permission to see site,
    // so we delete the content of the website
    pagina.remove();
} else {
    pagina.style.visibility = 'visible'; 
    // this webpage had 'hidden' visibility when loaded
}
});
```

<div class='level2'>
- **append( ) function** \
[Description](https://www.javascripttutorial.net/javascript-dom/javascript-append/): 
_Use the parentNode.append() method to append a set of Node objects or DOMString objects after the last child node of the parentNode._ \
Example:
```js
let title = document.querySelector('h2');
let langs = ['html','css','javascript'];

let items = langs.map( lang => {
    let li = document.createElement('li');
    li.innerHTML = lang;
    return li;
});

title.append(...items);

title.append('texto')
```
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **prepend( ) function** \
It works similar to `append()`, but the inserted element(s) goes before the 
**first child** of the parent Node to which such function is being applied.
<p style="margin-bottom: -10px;">&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<div class='level2'>
- **Use R variables inside JavaScript** \
Example:
```{r, echo = FALSE, comment=NA}
cat(paste0('```{r}\n','x <- 2\n','word <- "hello, "\n','```\n','<script>\n',  'function suma(a,b){\n',    'return a+b\n',  '}\n',  'console.log(suma(2,`r x+2`));\n',  'console.log("`r word`"+"world!");\n','</script>'))
```

Such _trick_ only works inside a **script** tag, **not inside js chunks**. \
**Disclaimer:** This only works _once_ per knit; it does not make **Shiny** worthless.
